62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (02:54): Most different types of data aren't really different "types" in that they're mostly objects, but rather different prototypes, so sometimes you use simple string/number literal tricks or constructors like Number and String or utilities like parseInt and parseFloat

62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (02:55): PHP is on the server, not on the client

73fc6e1a3e63ff58fe81d9cf3f380518 (03:19): if I programatically create a TD, TR and TABLE, appendChild them in the right order, THEN add some text node to the TD, will my TABLE have that text appear in its cell? (are javascript variables pointers and are the parameters passed into functions as references?)
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (03:20): variables are like references
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (03:20): Arguments are by value
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (03:20): *variables hold reference-like things
73fc6e1a3e63ff58fe81d9cf3f380518 (03:21): ok, so within a function, i don't have to worry about doing appendChild only after I've setup a node exactly as I want it, correct?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (03:21): If setting up the node includes appending it to whatever should contain it... then that's all it takes to add it to the DOM in the right place.
73fc6e1a3e63ff58fe81d9cf3f380518 (03:22): ok, thanks
